document.docAuthor: Yang, Zi-Zhong, Zhu, Ming-Sheng & Song, Da-Xiang
document.docTitle: Sanmenia gongshan Yang, Zhu & Song, 2006, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the genus Sanmenia Song & Kim, 1992 (Araneae, Thomisidae) from Yunnan Province, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of the genus Sanmenia Song & Kim, 1992 (Araneae, Thomisidae) from Yunnan Province, China

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 6. Sanmenia gongshan sp. nov. 1 Female body, dorsal view; 2 Male body, dorsal view; 3 Left chelicerae, female, posterior view; 4 Left chelicerae, male, posterior view; 5 Epigyne, ventral view; 6 Same, dorsal view; Scale bars: 1 – 2, 0.5 mm; 3 – 6, 0.1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 7 – 9. Left male palp (7 prolateral view; 8 ventral view; 9 retrolateral view). Scale bars: 0.1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 10. Known distribution of the genus Sanmenia in China, Japan and Singapore.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Holotype male, CHINA : Yunnan Province, Gongshan County, Gaoligong Mountains Nature Reserve, 1500–1600m , Dandang Park,
27 º 43 ’N
,
98 º 39 ’E
,
3 May 2004
, Z. Z. Yang leg. ( MHBU ). Paratypes : two females and one male, same data as holotype ( MHBU ); six females and three males, same data as holotype ( CDLC ).

Additional material examined: Three males, CHINA : Yunnan Province, Yingjiang County, Gangmeng Town,
24 º 40 ’N
,
97 º 59 ’E
, 1050 m ,
16 May 2004
, Z. Z. Yang, leg. ( MHBU ).

Diagnosis: The new species differs from
S. kohi
(
Ono 1995 : 163 , figs 8–15
) and
S. zhengi
(
Song & Zhu 1997 : 29 , figs 13 A–F
) by the following combination of characters: RTA large, combined with VTA basally; spermathecae distinctly reniform; chelicerae of both sexes with three promarginal and four retromarginal teeth respectively.
Etymology: The specific name refers to the type locality and is a noun in apposition.

Opisthosoma oval, brown, furnished with numerous short setae; posterior half of dorsum with a pair of brown spot; margin with some short brown stripes; venter yellowish brown; spinnerets yellowish brown.

Patellae, tibiae and metatarsi of legs I–II reddish brown; tibiae and metatarsi of legs I– II with some thick spines. Other parts of legs yellowish brown. Spiniformation of legs: femora: I–IV dorsal 0­1 ­ 1 , I prolateral 0­ 0­1 ­ 1 ­ 1 , retrolateral 0­1 ­ 1 ­ 1 ­0; patellae: I–IV dorsal 1 ­ 1 (weak); tibiae: I–II dorsal 1 ­ 0­1 (weak), I–II pro­ and retrolateral 1 ­ 1 ­ 1 , respectively, ventral 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 (strong), III–IV dorsal 1 ­ 0­1 , pro­ and retrolateral 1 ­ 0­1 , respectively, ventral 0­2 (apical); metatarsi I–II pro­ and retrolateral 1 ­ 0­1 , respectively, ventral 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 , III–IV pro­ and retrolateral 0­1 ­ 1 , ventral 0­2 ­ 2 . Leg formula: 1243 . Measurements of legs:

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–6.
Sanmenia gongshan
sp. nov. 1 Female body, dorsal view; 2 Male body, dorsal view; 3 Left chelicerae, female, posterior view; 4 Left chelicerae, male, posterior view; 5 Epigyne, ventral view; 6 Same, dorsal view; Scale bars: 1–2, 0.5 mm; 3–6, 0.1 mm.
FIGURES 7–9. Left male palp (7 prolateral view; 8 ventral view; 9 retrolateral view). Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 10. Known distribution of the genus
Sanmenia
in China, Japan and Singapore.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Male palp as shown in
Figs. 7–9
. Tibia with six trichobothria, RTA large, combined with VTA basally. Bulb simple, longer than wide, apophysis absent; embolus thin and long, originating medially on prolateral side of bulb; conductor large and lamellar.

Patella, tibia, metatarsus and tarsus of leg I dark brown. Spiniformation of legs: Femora: I–IV dorsal 0­1 ­ 1 , I prolateral 0­1 ­ 1 ; patellae: I–IV dorsal 1 ­ 1 (weak); tibiae: I–IV dorsal 0­1 ­0­ 0­2 (apical), I–II pro­ and retrolateral 1 ­ 1 ­ 1 , respectively, ventral 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 (strong), III–IV prolateral 1 ­ 1 , ventral 1 ­ 1 ­ 1 (right); metatarsi I–II pro­ and retrolateral 1 ­ 0­1 , respectively, ventral 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 ­ 2 (apical), III–IV pro­ and retrolateral 0­1 ­ 1 , ventral 0­2 ­ 2 . Leg formula: 1243 .
femur patella+ tibia metatarsus tarsus total

Variation: Body length: males 3.42–3.87 , females 3.31–4.53 . Prosoma: males length 1.54–1.83 , width 1.51–1.80 ; females length 1.68–2.05 , width 1.64–2.03 . Opisthosoma: males length 2.02–2.08 , width 1.76–1.92 ; females length 2.86–3.16 , width 2.96–3.16 . Distribution: China : the Northwest area of Yunnan Province, shown as
Fig. 10
.
